author: Get News
title: Family Private Care Affirms Its Commitment to Quality Home Care in Lawrenceville, GA | User | theeveningleader.com
text:
Family Private Care Services in Lawrenceville, GA, reaffirms its commitment to providing top-tier home care, ensuring comfort and dignity for seniors in their own homes. With a focus on personalized care plans and holistic well-being, they continue to meet the community's needs for reliable, compassionate service. For more details, Google it at https://familyprivatecarellc.com Lawrenceville, GA - Family Private Care Services, a foremost provider in the realm of home care services, today reasserts its pledge to maintain the highest standards of home care for residents of Lawrenceville, GA. This announcement underscores the organization's enduring commitment to the community, ensuring that local families seeking senior care in Lawrenceville, GA, for their loved ones, will continue to have access to unparalleled support, fostering both comfort and dignity in their own homes. This ongoing commitment is a response to the consistent demand from the community for reliable and superior home care solutions, spotlighting the significance of tailored care plans and the holistic well-being of every individual served.
"Family Private Care stands as a beacon of excellence in Lawrenceville, continually striving to elevate the standard of home care provided to our community," stated Tony Plummer, owner of Family Private Care Services. "Our dedication goes beyond providing services; it's about nurturing a network of support for our families, ensuring every individual in our care lives a fulfilling life. As we move forward, our commitment to this mission is unwavering, driven by a desire to meet and exceed the evolving needs of our community, thereby affirming that our clients and their families receive the compassionate, personalized care they truly deserve."
At the heart of Family Private Care's philosophy is a personalized approach to home care designed to meet each client's needs. From daily living support to comprehensive health care needs, this bespoke approach guarantees clients an enhanced quality of life, promoting independence, comfort, and overall well-being.
Families in Lawrenceville, GA, searching for premier home care services can turn to Family Private Care for their loved ones' needs.
For more information about Family Private Care Services and their home care in Lawrenceville, GA , please visit their website at https://familyprivatecarellc.com
About Family Private Care Services:
Family Private Care is a leading provider of home care services in Lawrenceville, GA. Renowned for its commitment to excellence and a team of devoted care professionals, Family Private Care offers an extensive range of services tailored to meet the varied needs of the elderly community. Dedicated to improving the lives of seniors and their families, Family Private Care remains the preferred choice for those searching for compassionate, high-quality care in the comfort of their homes.
Media Contact
Company Name: Family Private Care LLC
Contact Person: Tony Plummer
Email: Send Email
Phone: +17705253252
Address: 1905 Woodstock Rd STE 5200
City: Roswell
State: GA
Country: United States
Website: https://familyprivatecarellc.com/

author: Daniel
title: Consultor de SIRH: habilidades, tareas, formaciÃ³n
text:
Â¿Te interesa la profesiÃ³n de Consultor SIRH, pero no sabes por dÃ³nde empezar? Esta guÃ­a completa te ilumina sobre el rol, las misiones, las competencias, el salario y las formaciones a seguir para embarcarte en esta carrera de futuro, en la encrucijada de los RR.HH. y la tecnologÃ­a. Ya sea que seas estudiante, estÃ©s en reconversiÃ³n o ya trabajes en RR.HH., descubre si esta profesiÃ³n es para ti.
Â¿QuÃ© es un Consultor SIRH?
DefiniciÃ³n de la profesiÃ³n
El consultor SIRH â€“ para Sistema de InformaciÃ³n de Recursos Humanos â€“ es un experto hÃ­brido, en la encrucijada entre la tÃ©cnica y los recursos humanos. Su rol principal consiste en modernizar los procesos de RR.HH. mediante software como Oracle HCM, SAP SuccessFactors y
SAGE Business Cloud. Interviene cada vez que una empresa desea digitalizar sus prÃ¡cticas, mejorar su gestiÃ³n del talento, o implementar un nuevo software de RR.HH.
En otras palabras, si te gusta comprender el funcionamiento de las herramientas mientras trabajas con equipos de RR.HH., esta profesiÃ³n podrÃ­a realmente corresponderte. Pero entonces, Â¿cÃ³mo se distingue de un simple consultor de RR.HH.?
Â¿CuÃ¡l es la diferencia entre un consultor de RR.HH. y un consultor SIRH?
|Consultor de RR.HH.||Consultor SIRH|
|Enfoca su acciÃ³n en los procesos humanos: reclutamiento, formaciÃ³n, carrera, gestiÃ³n de RR.HH.||Se especializa en la implementaciÃ³n de herramientas digitales para gestionar estos procesos|
|Poca relaciÃ³n con los sistemas de informaciÃ³n||Trabaja en estrecha colaboraciÃ³n con el departamento de TI para integrar y configurar soluciones de RRHH|
|A menudo centrado en la estrategia de RR.HH. y la gestiÃ³n del cambio||Combina anÃ¡lisis funcional y habilidades tÃ©cnicas en software especializado|
El consultor SIRH actÃºa como un facilitador digital en los recursos humanos. Pero su rol no se detiene ahÃ­. Veamos ahora quÃ© hace concretamente en el dÃ­a a dÃ­a.
Las misiones de un Consultor SIRH
ImplementaciÃ³n o mejora de un SIRH
Cada empresa posee sus especificidades, sus restricciones, sus expectativas. AhÃ­ es donde interviene el consultor SIRH. EstarÃ¡s encargado de comprender las necesidades de tus clientes o de tu empleador, luego de diseÃ±ar una soluciÃ³n digital que les corresponda. IdentificarÃ¡s los software a integrar, configurarÃ¡s los mÃ³dulos, y velarÃ¡s por su interoperabilidad con las herramientas existentes o acompaÃ±arÃ¡s
la transformaciÃ³n digital si aÃºn no se ha implementado ningÃºn sistema.
En la prÃ¡ctica, esto significa trabajar en temas tan variados como la gestiÃ³n de vacaciones, la nÃ³mina, las entrevistas anuales, o la formaciÃ³n. Todo ello asegurando la coherencia, fluidez y fiabilidad de los datos de RR.HH.
Asesoramiento a los equipos de RR.HH. y DSI
Eres un eslabÃ³n clave entre los RR.HH. y la informÃ¡tica. Los RR.HH. a menudo tienen una visiÃ³n de negocio, pero poco conocimiento tÃ©cnico. La DSI, por su parte, domina las herramientas, pero no siempre las sutilezas de RR.HH. Tu rol es traducir las necesidades de unos en soluciones comprensibles para los otros.
Debes entonces demostrar escucha, sentido de sÃ­ntesis, y a veces diplomacia, para acompaÃ±ar los proyectos de principio a fin. Si te gusta el trabajo transversal, este rol es para ti.
AcompaÃ±amiento al cambio y formaciÃ³n de los usuarios
La tecnologÃ­a sola no es suficiente. Para que un software sea adoptado, hay que convencer, explicar, formar. Como consultor SIRH, acompaÃ±as a los usuarios en el manejo de las nuevas herramientas. Preparas guÃ­as, animas sesiones de formaciÃ³n, respondes a las preguntas.
Te conviertes entonces en el referente sobre la soluciÃ³n implementada. Â¿Tu objetivo? Hacer que cada colaborador, de RR.HH. o gerencial, se sienta confiado con la herramienta, y la use eficazmente en el dÃ­a a dÃ­a.
Â¿QuÃ© competencias se necesitan para convertirse en Consultor SIRH?
Competencias tÃ©cnicas
Para tener Ã©xito como Consultor SIRH, debes combinar conocimiento digital y comprensiÃ³n fina de las necesidades de RR.HH. Estas son las competencias tÃ©cnicas imprescindibles para desarrollar:
- Dominio de los software SIRH (SAP, Workday, Talentsoftâ€¦).
- Buen conocimiento de los procesos de RR.HH.: NÃ³mina, vacaciones, gestiÃ³n del talento, etc.
- Competencias en gestiÃ³n de proyectos: PlanificaciÃ³n, coordinaciÃ³n, reporting.
- Capacidad para formular necesidades funcionales claras y precisas.
- Facilidad con Excel avanzado, a veces
SQLo un lenguaje de script.
- Familiaridad con los flujos de datos, las API y la interoperabilidad
- ComprensiÃ³n de los desafÃ­os de la ciberseguridad relacionados con los datos de RR.HH.
No necesitas ser desarrollador, pero una cultura tÃ©cnica sÃ³lida es una gran ventaja para trabajar eficazmente con los equipos de TI.
Competencias relacionales
En esta profesiÃ³n, tus cualidades humanas y relacionales son igualmente cruciales. Debes demostrar un gran sentido de la escucha por comprender las necesidades de tus interlocutores, ya sean de RR.HH. o tÃ©cnicos. La pedagogÃ­a tambiÃ©n es esencial: a menudo estarÃ¡s llamado a explicar herramientas complejas a usuarios novatos.
AÃ±ade a esto una comunicaciÃ³n clara, adaptabilidad ante imprevistos, y una buena capacidad de sÃ­ntesis. Son estas cualidades, a menudo subestimadas, las que te harÃ¡n un consultor apreciado y eficaz.
Â¿CuÃ¡l es el salario de un Consultor SIRH?
Panorama general de los salarios
|Nivel de experiencia||Salario bruto anual estimado||Observaciones|
|Principiante (Junior)||27 500 â‚¬ â€“ 33 000 â‚¬||Puede alcanzar hasta 38 000 â‚¬ en consultorÃ­as especializadas|
|2 a 5 aÃ±os de experiencia||42 000 â‚¬ â€“ 50 000 â‚¬||EvoluciÃ³n rÃ¡pida, segÃºn responsabilidades y tareas|
|MÃ¡s de 5 aÃ±os de experiencia||50 000 â‚¬ â€“ 60 000 â‚¬||Posibilidad de superar este rango en grandes empresas o como freelance|
Variables: sector, regiÃ³n, estatus freelance o asalariado
Como a menudo, el salario tambiÃ©n depende del sector de actividad, la regiÃ³n, y el estatus. En ÃŽle-de-France, las remuneraciones son mÃ¡s altas. Los consultores independientes, por su parte, pueden facturar entre 450 â‚¬ y 650 â‚¬ por dÃ­a, con mÃ¡s flexibilidad, pero tambiÃ©n mÃ¡s responsabilidades.
Â¿QuÃ© formaciÃ³n seguir para convertirse en Consultor SIRH?
Estudios recomendados (Bac+3 a Bac+5)
Si aspiras a una carrera de Consultor SIRH, un recorrido acadÃ©mico sÃ³lido, que mezcle recursos humanos e informÃ¡tica, suele constituir el camino real. Tras un bac+3, puedes orientarte hacia un Master en RR.HH., un Master MIAGE (mÃ©todos informÃ¡ticos aplicados a la gestiÃ³n de empresas), o un tÃ­tulo de ingeniero con especializaciÃ³n en sistemas de informaciÃ³n. Estas formaciones te permitirÃ¡n adquirir la doble competencia tan buscada por las empresas: comprender los desafÃ­os humanos a la vez que dominas las herramientas digitales que los respaldan.
Formaciones profesionales especializadas
Si ya estÃ¡s en el trabajo o en reconversiÃ³n, estÃ¡n hechas para ti algunas formaciones profesionales. EncontrarÃ¡s programas cortos, intensivos y certificantes, diseÃ±ados para entrenarte en competencias directamente operativas. AprenderÃ¡s a implementar SIRH, a gestionar los flujos de datos de RR.HH., a colaborar con las DSI y a acompaÃ±ar la transformaciÃ³n digital de las empresas.
El enfoque es pragmÃ¡tico, basado en casos concretos, con un acompaÃ±amiento personalizado. Progresas a tu ritmo, en lÃ­nea, mientras eres guiado por expertos del campo. Un formato flexible, adaptado a quienes quieren cambiar de rumbo o adquirir nuevas habilidades sin alterar demasiado su calendario.
Â¿CuÃ¡les son las perspectivas de evoluciÃ³n?
Hacia un puesto de jefe de proyecto SIRH
Una vez que has adquirido experiencia, puedes evolucionar naturalmente hacia un puesto de jefe de proyecto SIRH. Te conviertes entonces en el piloto de los proyectos digitales de RR.HH., el que orquesta el despliegue de herramientas, haciendo el enlace entre los proveedores, los equipos de RR.HH. y la DSI. Ganas en autonomÃ­a, en responsabilidad, y comienzas a intervenir en estrategias de mayor escala.
Es un paso lÃ³gico si te gusta la gestiÃ³n, el seguimiento de planes, los desafÃ­os humanos tanto como tÃ©cnicos. Y tambiÃ©n es un excelente puente hacia posiciones aÃºn mÃ¡s estratÃ©gicas.
Hacia un rol de DSI o DRH digital
Con una visiÃ³n global, y un dominio de los desafÃ­os tecnolÃ³gicos, algunos consultores evolucionan hacia puestos de direcciÃ³n. PodrÃ­as convertirte en DSI, o DRH digital, segÃºn tu inclinaciÃ³n. Estos roles requieren una sÃ³lida experiencia, pero tambiÃ©n una visiÃ³n prospectiva: cÃ³mo transformar la empresa, cÃ³mo hacer del digital un motor de rendimiento, cÃ³mo acompaÃ±ar el cambio cultural.
Si te gusta pensar a largo plazo, y si te sientes a gusto con la estrategia de empresa, esos puestos pueden convertirse en un destino natural de tu recorrido.
Posibilidades como freelance o en gabinete de consultorÃ­a
Y si prefieres la libertad, la independencia, el consulting tambiÃ©n puede ejercerse en calidad de freelance o dentro de un gabinete de consultorÃ­a. Eliges tus misiones, tus clientes, tus ritmos. Tocas proyectos variados, en sectores mÃºltiples. Requiere mÃ¡s agilidad, pero tambiÃ©n es una oportunidad de construir tu expertise, valorarla, y a veces, crear tu propia actividad.
ConclusiÃ³n
El rol de Consultor SIRH conjuga tecnologÃ­a, estrategia de RR.HH. y transformaciÃ³n digital, en el corazÃ³n de los desafÃ­os actuales de las empresas. Ya sea que estÃ©s al inicio de tu carrera, en reconversiÃ³n o simplemente curioso, ahora tienes todas las cartas en la mano para comprender los contornos de esta profesiÃ³n y considerar un futuro estimulante y duradero en este sector.
TÃ³mate el tiempo de explorar las formaciones, hazte las preguntas correctas, y por quÃ© noâ€¦ lÃ¡nzate. El mercado nunca ha sido tan demandante de perfiles capaces de conectar humanos, herramientas y rendimiento.

author: Bonelli
title: Tedeum: frente a Milei, la Iglesia pidiÃ³ â€œtomarse en serio las parÃ¡lisis del puebloâ€ | Bonelli
text: El arzobispo porteÃ±o, Jorge GarcÃ­a Cuerva, anticipÃ³ que en su homilÃ­a del Tedeum por el 25 de Mayo buscarÃ¡ â€œuna reflexiÃ³n de todos los actores de la sociedad argentinaâ€, pero pidiÃ³ que sus palabras no sean tomadas para â€œalimentar la fragmentaciÃ³nâ€. â€œEl mensaje que compartirÃ© quiere ser un aporte a la luz de la palabra de Dios para la reflexiÃ³n de todos los actores de la sociedad argentina, convencido de que entre todos construimos la Patria, mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de saber que, luego, puedan ser tomadas algunas frases aisladas para querer alimentar la fragmentaciÃ³nâ€, asegurÃ³ el cardenal primado de la Argentina al iniciar la ceremonia eclesiÃ¡stica en la Catedral Metropolitana. Desayuno con el Gabinete en plena tensiÃ³n, Tedeum y acto de mayo en CÃ³rdoba: el cronograma de Milei para el 25 de mayo Y continuÃ³: â€œHoy nos ponemos delante de Dios como naciÃ³n y le pedimos que nos cure, porque parecemos tener las manos paralizadas para el encuentro que construye fraternidad, las manos paralizadas para abrazar a los heridos por la soledad y la tristeza, las manos paralizadas para ser solidarios con los que menos tienenâ€ â€œY tambiÃ©n le pedimos a Dios que nos preserve de las manos manchadas de sangre por el narcotrÃ¡fico, de las manos sucias de la corrupciÃ³n y la coima, de las manos en el bolsillo del egoÃ­smo y la indiferenciaâ€, seÃ±alÃ³ GarcÃ­a Cuerva. En su homilÃ­a, el arzobispo expresÃ³: â€œTenemos que tomarnos en serio las parÃ¡lisis de nuestro pueblo. Sabemos que hay parÃ¡lisis que no se pueden procrastinar: su postergaciÃ³n en nombre de un futuro prometedor generarÃ­an consecuencias nefastas por irreversibles en la vida de las personas y por lo tanto de toda la sociedad, un precio muy alto a pagar que no nos podemos permitir: la malnutriciÃ³n en la primera infancia, la falta de escolarizaciÃ³n y accesibilidad a los servicios de salud, los ancianos y jubilados incapaces de sostenerse diariamente con un mÃ­nimo de dignidad, son algunos de esos ejemplos impostergablesâ€.

author: Ashley Chan
title: Low-Dose Revlimid May Delay Time to Blood Transfusion Dependency in MDS
text: Reference â€œLow dose lenalidomide versus placebo in non-transfusion dependent patients with low risk, del(5q) myelodysplastic syndromes (SintraREV): a randomised, double-blind, phase 3 trialâ€ by MarÃ­a DÃ­ez-Campelo, et al., The Lancet Haematology. News Article The quality and rate of treatment responses in patients with myelodysplastic syndromes were shown to improve with low doses of Revlimid across two years. Patients with non-transfusion dependent myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS) who were treated with low doses of Revlimid (lenalidomide) across two years experienced a delay in the time to blood transfusion dependency, researchers have found. Revlimid is an oral treatment that is used to treat patients with anemia (low levels of red blood cells) and patients with a certain type of MDS. Specifically, patients with MDS who experience anemia and are dependent on blood transfusions may benefit most from the treatment, according to the Mayo Clinic. In the phase 3 SintraRev study published in The Lancet Hematology, researchers found that treatment with low doses of Revlimid throughout the span of two years may slow the time to transfusion dependence, improve the rate and quality of treatment responses and demonstrate a manageable safety profile for patients with chromosome 5q deletion MDS who are non-transfusion dependent. A total of 61 patients were randomly assigned to two groups: the Revlimid group (40 patients) or the placebo group (inactive drug; 21 patients). The median time to treatment was 66 weeks, with approximately 95.9 weeks in patients from the Revlimid group and approximately 42.7 months in patients from the placebo group, according to the study. Of note, 19 of 40 patients from the Revlimid group successfully completed treatment compared with seven of 21 patients from the placebo group, researchers noted. Early discontinuation was caused by disease progression (worsening or spreading) in eight of 19 patients in the Revlimid group and 10 of 14 patients in the placebo group. â€œ[Revlimid] reduced the time of transfusion dependence,â€ the researchers wrote. â€œDelaying transfusion dependence aims to improve quality of life and avoid relevant complications related to transfusion dependence, including potentially decreasing the risk of acute myeloid leukemia progression and even improving overall survival.â€ Among the total patients in the study, 43 of 61 had low-risk MDS and 18 patients had intermediate-1-risk MDS. There were 54 total patients who had chromosome 5q deletions, researchers established. At a median follow-up of 60.6 months in the intent-to-treat population, 23 patients developed blood transfusion dependence. Ten and 13 patients from the Revlimid and placebo groups, respectively, developed transfusion dependence, as stated in the study. Specifically, treatment with Revlimid reduced the risk of blood transfusion dependency by 69.8%. The median time to transfusion dependence from the time of treatment was longer in patients who received Revlimid compared with patients in the placebo group. In particular, the median time to transfusion dependence was not reached in the Revlimid group (meaning more than half of patients were not transfusion dependent upon the time of assessment) compared with 11.6 months in the placebo group. Time to transfusion dependence from diagnosis was also measured in the patient population, according to the study. Patients from the Revlimid group demonstrated more favorable outcomes regarding time to transfusion dependence from diagnosis because the median time was not reached. This means patients treated with Revlimid had a longer time until blood transfusion dependence than estimated by researchers. Compared with the Revlimid group, for which median time to transfusion dependence was not reached, patients in the placebo group had a median time of 25.9 months to transfusion dependence from diagnosis. The safety of Revlimid was also reviewed by researchers during the trial in 59 patients. They established that 40 of 59 patients developed at least one side effect that was potentially related to treatment. The most frequent treatment-related side effect that was reported was neutropenia (lower levels of white blood cell counts), which occurred in 24 of 38 patients from the Revlimid group and four of 21 patients in the placebo group. â€œLow dose lenalidomide versus placebo in non-transfusion dependent patients with low risk, del(5q) myelodysplastic syndromes (SintraREV): a randomised, double-blind, phase 3 trialâ€ by MarÃ­a DÃ­ez-Campelo, et al., The Lancet Haematology. The second most common side effect was thrombocytopenia (abnormally low levels of platelets in the blood), researchers stated. This occurred in seven patients from the Revlimid group and none of the patients from the placebo group. Of note, there were no reported treatment-related deaths in either treatment group, researchers stated. â€œ[Revlimid] was well tolerated, with a manageable safety profile and no increased rates of acute myeloid leukemia progression,â€ the researchers wrote. â€œThese findings support the efficacy of low-dose [Revlimid] in patients who are not transfusion dependent, for whom early [treatment of anemia](https://www.curetoday.com/view/reblozyl-may-be-the-standard-of-care-now-in-lower-risk-mds-anemia) could be crucial to improve disease outcomes.â€ For more news on cancer updates, research and education, donâ€™t forget to [subscribe to CUREÂ®â€™s newsletters here.](https://one.curetoday.com/subscribe/) [FDA Approves Vyloy for HER2-Negative Gastric or GEJ Adenocarcinoma](/view/fda-approves-vyloy-for-her2-negative-gastric-or-gej-adenocarcinoma?utm_source=www.curetoday.com&utm_medium=relatedContent) [Danielle Fishel Undergoes Surgery for Breast Cancer, TikTok Star Dies of Rare Liver Cancer and More](/view/danielle-fishel-undergoes-surgery-for-breast-cancer-tiktok-star-dies-of-rare-liver-cancer-and-more?utm_source=www.curetoday.com&utm_medium=relatedContent)

author: Prince J. Grimes
title: Deion Sanders is the only person who can save the Cowboys
text:
Deion Sanders is the only person who can save the Cowboys Share this article share tweet text email link on Facebook on Twitter via text message on LinkedIn via email https://ftw.usatoday.com/2025/01/deion-sanders-cowboys-head-coach-save-jerry-jones January 16, 2025 4:48 pm ET The Dallas Cowboys have interest in hiring Deion Sanders as their next head coach. Sanders all but confirmed as much when he told ESPN about his conversation with Cowboys owner Jerry Jones, calling the opportunity â€œintriguing.â€
The early connection has been enough to elevate Sanders to betting favorite to become Dallasâ€™ next coach. Cowboys insider Ed Werder reported that Sanders would almost certainly accept the job if Jones offers it. For the sake of the teamâ€™s fans, heâ€™d better. Sanders might be the only person who can save them.
â€œTo hear from Jerry Jones is truly delightful, and itâ€™s intriguing,â€ Deion Sanders told ESPN on Monday night. â€œI love Jerry and believe in Jerry. After you hang up, and process it, and think about it, itâ€™s intriguing. But I love Boulder and everything there is about our team,â€¦ pic.twitter.com/OMossS9iOx
â€” Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) January 14, 2025
For the last 30 years since Dallas won the Super Bowl in 1994, the team has been stuck in a state of arrested development, unable to advance further than the second round of the playoffs no matter how good it looks in the regular season. You can point to different reasons in different years, but the only constant in that time has been Jones, who continues to hold significant influence over the roster and team operations.
That power he so proudly wields is likely whatâ€™s been holding Dallas back. Just ask the players who complained to ESPN about the intrusive fan facility tours that Jones doesnâ€™t seem to think is a problem, probably because they make him money. Or ask the quarterback who helped Jones win his only Super Bowl titles, Troy Aikman.
"I love the Dallas Cowboys. I played there for 12 years. I wish them well but to say that it's a coveted job I'm not sure I would necessarily agree with that."
Cowboys legend Troy Aikman does not think coaches are lining up to come to Dallas ðŸ˜² pic.twitter.com/FRC0jmSm5Q
â€” ESPN (@espn) January 14, 2025
â€œAs far as a coveted job, I donâ€™t know that thatâ€™s accurate,â€ Aikman said on ESPNâ€™s Monday Night Countdown after the team split with Mike McCarthy. â€œI do think the Cowboys are obviously a high-profile team. Whoever is head coach of that team is certainly going to draw a lot of attention. But I think most football people that take over as a head coach, they want to do it on their terms. And thatâ€™s hard to do.â€
You donâ€™t have to read too deep into Aikmanâ€™s words to understand his point. Coaching the Cowboys doesnâ€™t come on your terms. It comes with a sacrifice of some control.
So, what would it take for that to change? Itâ€™s possible thereâ€™s nothing that can make Jones give up decision-making for the team heâ€™s owned since 1989. He was, after all, the owner when they won those three Super Bowls in the 90s. But if there was one thing that might persuade Jones to take a backseat, itâ€™d be a hot coaching candidate who happens to also be one of the best players in Cowboys history who Jones has a personal relationship with. Someone he feels like he can trust. Someone like Deion Sanders.
Regarding Deion Sanders: Iâ€™m being told that he would almost certainly accept if Jerry Jones offers to make him the next #Cowboys head coach, that those around him are encouraging him to pursue it and that Jones is enamored with the idea.
â€” Ed Werder (@WerderEdNFL) January 16, 2025
It wouldnâ€™t be a first-time head coach like Kellen Moore, whom Jones likely already knows he can control from his previous stint in Dallas. Or a veteran coach like Bill Belichick, who would only clash with Jones over different decisions. Itâ€™d be the guy who knows how to massage Jonesâ€™ ego and make him feel like his input is valued, even when itâ€™s not. Or, better yet, someone whose input Jones values.
Whether or not Sanders can actually be a good head coach at the professional level is another question. But he proved his mettle in the college ranks, leading Jackson State to back-to-back Black college football national championship games before taking a broken, one-win Colorado program to nine wins and a bowl game in just two years. He deserves the opportunity to find out.
Cowboys fans should hope Jones is doing everything he can to give Sanders that opportunity. It may be the best chance they have at saving their team.
